title: Proclamation on Enhancing Vetting Capabilities and Processes for Detecting Attempted Entry Into the United States by Terrorists or Other Public-Safety Threats – The White House
content:
Fact Sheets

BackgroundNational Security BaselineRobust Review and Engagement ProcessCountry-Specific Travel Restrictions:New Baseline for Information Sharing to Support Visa and Immigration Vetting Determinations:
I. Identity Management: Establishing identity is a critical factor in effective immigration vetting. Under this standard, countries must improve passport integrity by:II. National Security and Public Safety Information: Effective admissibility decisions cannot be made without knowledge of a traveler’s potential criminal or terrorist history. Countries must:III.
